posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked:
We opened a neo 550 and it had no mounting holes… we’re 0 for 2 on rev qc today. Very disappointed IMG_0559 3024×4032 2.26 MB @Greg_Needel

IMG_0559 3024×4032 2.26 MB

IMG_0559 3024×4032 2.26 MB

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked: Looks like the pinion was pressed (glued?) on before the missing holes were noticed.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Pressed, we’d just removed it from the first 550 that had a dead phase out of the box

posts.name: Nyx
posts.cooked:
Hot glue it in place. /s for somewhat obvious reasons

In all seriousness though, assuming it works, it might be an excellent testing motor if you just tape or glue it in place for programming practice.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Everything and nothing, all at the same time

posts.custom_user_title: Everything and nothing, all at the same time

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked: Just FYI, it’s possible to pop the pinion back off using two flathead screwdrivers, one on each side, using the edge of the 550 as a fulcrum.

posts.name: Katie
posts.cooked: You could probably sell it. Idk who would buy it, but I dont doubt someone would want this.

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked:
KatieKat:

who would buy it

It would not be a shocker if REV wanted it.  I’ve worked for motor manufacturers who would be very interested in paying to have a defective product returned.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: The RC car folks sell a puller that will take pinions off of a 550…

posts.name: REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO
posts.cooked: @cmdada please send us an email and we will take care of it ASAP

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked: ^ It’s very helpful when you can send photos or even a box of garbage to your supplier/mfg and be like “why tho?”, especially if there are lot numbers or serials.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked:
they sent us a replacement that we installed and is working fine IMG_0618 3024×4032 3.03 MB

IMG_0618 3024×4032 3.03 MB

IMG_0618 3024×4032 3.03 MB

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Was the shiny cim a mfg defect or modification?

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: I’m still awaiting the answer to this… saw one in the wild last year and didn’t know

posts.name: Will C
posts.cooked: Ngl i’d buy it. Would just be fun to have and use to mess with people. Plus its a "limited edition"
